name: Tomato Rice
history: Tomato Rice, also known as Thakkali Sadam in South India, is a popular and flavorful dish. It is a part of traditional South Indian cuisine and is known for its tangy and spicy taste derived from ripe tomatoes and various spices.
description: Tomato Rice is a vibrant and delicious rice dish made with ripe tomatoes, spices, and herbs. It's a simple yet flavorful meal, often enjoyed with raita, papad, or as a standalone dish. The tanginess of tomatoes is perfectly balanced with the spices.

instructions.title: Cook the Rice
instructions.description: Wash and cook the basmati rice until it's 80% cooked. Drain and set aside.

instructions.title: Prepare the Tomato Mixture
instructions.description: In a frying pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Once they splutter, add onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. SautÃ© until onions are translucent. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil separates.

instructions.title: Combine Rice with Tomato Mixture
instructions.description: Add the cooked rice to the tomato mixture. Gently mix until the rice is evenly coated with the tomato mixture.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot as a main dish or with raita and papad.

tips: Use ripe and juicy tomatoes for the best flavor.
Be careful not to overcook the rice as it will be mixed with the tomato mixture.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or carrots for added nutrition.
For a spicier version, increase the amount of green chilies or red chili powder.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stove until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl with lemon wedges on the side.
Pair with a cooling cucumber raita for a balanced meal.
